commitResults.messageTitle: Bug report / Team response: Replace placeholder text with a hint (#716)
commitResults.messageBody:
When a user opens a new bug report / new team response,
the response form gets filled in with some placeholder text.

Users sometimes wish to submit their bug report / team response
without a written response. In these cases, they have to manually
delete the placeholder text, before submitting the form.

Let's replace the placeholder text with a hint, to make
the user experience smoother.

commitResults.messageTitle: Issue model: Remove unnecessary ternary operators (#715)
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's improve readability by removing the
ternary operator from some long / confusing statements
in the Issue class.

commitResults.messageTitle: RepoCreatorService: Create custom operators for attempting repo creation (#634)
commitResults.messageBody:
To improve readability of the session setup code in PhaseService,
let's shift the phase details verification and repo creation code 
into two, separate custom operators in  RepoCreatorService.

Let's also add tests for these custom operators.

commitResults.messageTitle: Include app version number in header and logs (#659)
commitResults.messageBody:
The app version number is displayed in the page title.
To aid debugging, let's give the version number more
prominence by displaying it on the header
and recording it in the logs too.

Let's move the version number to the AppConfig,
so we have a slightly neater method of accessing the
version number in various services and components.

commitResults.messageTitle: RepoCreatorService: Create custom operators for permissions request (#671)
commitResults.messageBody:
To improve readability of the session setup code, let's shift the 
request for repo creation permissions code into a custom operator
in RepoCreatorService.
  
Let's also add tests for this custom operator.

commitResults.messageTitle: ProfileService: read profiles from client data repo (#661)
commitResults.messageBody:
The app's default profiles are stored within the
codebase (in the AppConfig). Hence, updating the profiles
requires us to release / deploy a new version of CATcher.

Let's fetch the profiles from a client data repository instead.
This makes it possible to update the profiles
without modifying our codebase.

We can define a new ProfileService that uses a HTTP request
to fetch these profiles from the repo.

commitResults.messageTitle: Markdown Links: Fix redirection href values  (#666)
commitResults.messageBody:
Markdown links: Fix redirection href values

Our application crashes when an invalid link is rendered as HTML 
and the user clicks on the HTML Link. This is because there are no
checks done before the link is rendered. 

Let's open these links in a new tabs and propagate these errors there 
such that current users do not lose their current progress with respect 
to bug reports and other form data.

commitResults.messageTitle: AuthComponent: Log the selected settings repo (#720)
commitResults.messageBody:
For easier troubleshooting, let's log the name of the settings repo
selected by the user.

commitResults.messageTitle: PhaseService#storeSessionData: Remove current phase verification (#721)
commitResults.messageBody:
As the `assertSessionDataIntegrity` operator already performs
validation of the session data, there is no need to validate the
current phase again in the PhaseService#storeSessionData method.

Let's remove the additional check in PhaseService#storeSessionData.

commitResults.messageTitle: Upgrade to Electron v11 (#717)
commitResults.messageBody:
We are using Electron v9, which is no longer supported by the
Electron team. Let's incrementally adopt newer versions of
Electron, starting with v11.

To adopt Electron v11, all usages of the `remote` module have been
removed from ElectronService. This is because the Electron team
is planning to deprecate the `remote` module. This module is disabled
by default from Electron v10 onwards, marked for deprecation in v12,
and set for removal in v14.

The affected functionality has been re-implemented in the main
process code (main.ts and electron-utils/menu-bar.ts).

This change only involves functionality in the desktop app.
(specifically, the ability to open external links, clear cookies
and the "Inspect Element" feature).

Details on the deprecation of `remote` module can be found at:
- https://www.electronjs.org/docs/api/remote
- https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/21408
- https://www.electronjs.org/docs/breaking-changes#deprecated-remote-module

commitResults.messageTitle: SessionFixConfirmationComponent: Fix bug in permission prompt (#676)
commitResults.messageBody:
When CATcher requests permission to create a repo for bug reporting
phase, selecting "No thanks" does not prevent repo creation.
The app proceeds as if "Yes" was selected.

Let's fix this bug by ensuring that SessionFixConfirmationComponent
returns `false` (and not `undefined`) when "No thanks" is selected.

commitResults.messageTitle: IssuesDataTable: Move pagination logic into separate module, add tests (#668)
commitResults.messageBody:
Logic for paginating issues
is defined in a private method within IssuesDataTable.

Moving this logic to another module will improve separation of
concerns. Adding tests for this logic would help with future
regression testing.

Let's
* Move logic for paginating issues to another
  module
* Rename method name to paginateData
* Add tests for the module

commitResults.messageTitle: DuplicatedIssuesComponent: Add tests (#675)
commitResults.messageBody:
DuplicatedIssuesComponent lacks tests to ensure that it correctly
displays duplicate issues and can remove duplicate status.

Let's use Angular's DOM testing utilities to test that it
- displays all duplicated issues
- allows cancellation of duplicate status based on permissions
- removes duplicate status once user chooses cancel option

commitResults.messageTitle: Tester Response: Replace checkbox with radio buttons (#618)
commitResults.messageBody:
In the tester response phase, if the tester agrees with the
team's response, she needs to save the response without modifying
anything else, in order for the agreement to be recorded.

Let's provide a more intuitive method of "agreeing with the
team's response" by using radio buttons that allow the user
to explicitly choose between 'I Disagree' and 'I Agree'.

These radio buttons replace the checkbox control in the
tester response form.

commitResults.messageTitle: E2E Testing: Add test for new bug report creation (#596)
commitResults.messageBody:
To guard against regressions, let's add an E2E test that runs
the app through the entire sequence of steps taken when
creating a bug report.

These are:
- Clicking the 'New Issue' button
- Filling Issue Title + Description
- Selecting Issue Type + Severity
- Clicking Submit
- Verifying that new issue is reflected in the table of issues

When writing E2E tests, if you need to perform
multiple dropdown option selections, please refer
to PR #596 or selectDropDownOption in newIssue.po.ts
for information.

commitResults.messageTitle: Maintain session ID through phase change (#672)
commitResults.messageBody:
When the app navigates to a different phase, the IssueService's
session id is set to "undefined". Subsequently, any new bug reports
will have a meaningless (undefined) session id in their hidden data.

The session id should remain unmodified, even when switching between
phases. This will provide more flexibility for using the app.

To achieve this,
let's add a boolean parameter to the IssueService's reset logic,
to check if a session id reset is necessary when resetting data within
the IssueService.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added Logging to Issue Table Actions (#678)
commitResults.messageBody:
Logging has been limited in capturing user actions with the
IssueTable Component. To Fix this, all user actions tied to the
component will be logged.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix logging into non bugreporting phase (#691)
commitResults.messageBody:
There is an error incorrectly thrown in the log-in process,
when the bug reporting phase is not the first open phase.

This has been fixed with an additional check during session setup.

commitResults.messageTitle: Include version number in issues created (#656)
commitResults.messageBody:
We don't have a way of detecting which version of CATcher
was used to create a bug report.

Let's
* Include the CATcher version number in issues created
* Include the CATcher client being used (Desktop or Web)

This information will be stored in a HTML comment
of the form: "Version: {Web|Desktop} vX.X.X".

For example:
- <!--Version: Web v3.3.7-->
- <!--Version: Desktop v3.3.6-->

commitResults.messageTitle: Issues Faulty Component: Decompose logical expressions into methods (#683)
commitResults.messageBody:
IssuesFaultyComponent: Decompose logical expressions into methods

Logic expression for initialising default filter for
IssuesFaultyComponent is too long and has no tests. 

Let's
* decompose the logic expression to improve readability 
* add tests for default filter initialisation

commitResults.messageTitle: Add stack trace for errors (#682)
commitResults.messageBody:
Logs only contain error messages but do not include where the error was propagated, 
and lack context.

Let's 
* add a stack trace of the errors captured in the log file
